conclusion: Compute the weight of the child + sled
Weight W = mg = 40 kg × 10 m/s² = 400 N (downward)
Resolve the pulling force F = 100 N
Horizontal component: Fₓ = F cos 37° = 100 N × 0.8 = 80 N
Vertical component: Fᵧ = F sin 37° = 100 N × 0.6 = 60 N (upward)
Set up the vertical force balance (sled moves at constant speed ⇒ no vertical acceleration)
Upward forces: normal reaction N + Fᵧ; Downward force: weight W
Equilibrium: N + Fᵧ = W; N + 60 N = 400 N; N = 400 N – 60 N; N = 340 N
The magnitude of the force exerted by the sled on the ground is N = 3.4 × 10² N ≈ 340 N
